page.title: 15THE GOLF COURSE
page.content:
The Golf Course is on {Newark Links. It is a{nine hole course}over which both friendly and competitive matches are played. Holes are of different lengths and some have bunkers. One hole goes along{the beach}and many golf balls have been lost in the seaweed or{"swept out to sea."}
The "club house" is a caravan, along- side which is a small hut where the mower, flags and some of the twenty member's clubs are stored. The holes all have local place-names, names of Orkney birds, or have been named after people who helped to establish the club in 1977 _ here are the names:-{Newark Ho; The Warren; {Cooquoy Brae; Green's Fancy; Whaup's {Nest; Mackinnon's Rest; Lang & Weary; {Big John; Fraser's Bunkers.
